title: NCR emerge as primary hubs with 50% share of India's AI job openings: CBRE
description: Bengaluru and Delhi-NCR together account for more than 50 per cent of India's total Artificial Intelligence-related job openings, according to an analysis by CBRE Research. The findings, based on a study of over 64,500 active job listings on Naukri.com as of December 2025, reveal that Bengaluru serves as the primary hub for the technology's evolution with a 25.4 per cent share of total AI-related jobs, followed by Delhi-NCR at 24.8 per cent.
content: New Delhi [India], February 18 (ANI): Bengaluru and Delhi-NCR together account for more than 50 per cent of India's total Artificial Intelligence-related job openings, according to an analysis by CBRE Research. The findings, based on a study of over ... [2455 chars]

title: Netherlands PM Schoof arrives in India for Global AI Impact Summit
description: Prime Minister of Netherlands Dick Schoof arrived in India on Wednesday as the country hosts the seminal summit on artificial intelligence, bringing together leaders from across the world.
content:

title: Bonds swept up in leap of faith on AI productivity
description: Treasuries now appear to be riding the artificial intelligence frenzy, as speculation about the speed and scale of AI development spreads across companies and sectors — beating a drum for interest rate cuts if an outsize labor‑productivity boom follows.

title: OpenAI Launches AI Integration Drive with Top Indian Universities
description: OpenAI has announced partnerships with major Indian universities to integrate artificial intelligence across various educational domains. The initiative aims to equip over 100,000 students and faculty with AI skills, ensuring future readiness and bridging the gap between AI capabilities and their practical applications in diverse fields.
content: OpenAI has partnered with leading Indian universities to embed artificial intelligence across management, health, engineering, and creative education programs. This initiative aims to develop AI-ready talent for an increasingly tech-driven economy by... [807 chars]

title: Democratising Artificial Intelligence: The Swadeshi Model Of AI For All
description: As New Delhi hosts the world's first and largest AI summit, India is quietly rewriting the rules of who gets to build, use and benefit from artificial intelligence.
content:

title: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
description: Nvidia on Tuesday said it ​has signed a multiyear deal to sell ⁠Meta Platforms millions of its current and future artificial intelligence chips
content:
Nvidia on Tuesday said it ​has signed a multiyear deal to sell ⁠Meta Platforms millions of its current and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete with products from Intel and Advanced ‌Micro Devices.

title: Europe and India's Cooperative AI Path
description: Europe and India are aiming to foster a strong partnership in artificial intelligence by focusing on real-world applications. They prioritize cooperative development over a technological arms race, emphasizing trust and productivity while acknowledging the need for early regulation to prevent irreversible societal impacts.
content: In a bid to navigate the complexities of artificial intelligence (AI), Europe and India are joining forces to emphasize real-world applications over mere technological domination. This collaborative effort aims to create new opportunities while reduc... [685 chars]

title: Maharashtra showcases AI-driven agri transformation at India AI Impact Summit 2026
description: A key highlight was the work of the Maharashtra Artificial Intelligence and Agritech Innovation Center, which has compiled 26 transformative case studies.
content:
Maharashtra highlighted its use of Artificial Intelligence in agriculture during the India AI Impact Summit 2026, held at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi.

title: People won't lose jobs to AI, but to those who know AI: Microsoft President
description: At the India Today AI Summit 2026, Puneet Chandok, President of Microsoft India & South Asia, delivered a sharp message on the future of employment in the age of artificial intelligence stating that AI itself will not take away jobs, but professionals who fail to learn and adapt to AI tools risk being replaced by those who do.
content:
At a time when artificial intelligence is reshaping industries and redefining daily life, the conversation in India is no longer about adoption alone; it is about ownership.

title: Artificial Intelligence not a replacement for expertise: Airbus executive
description: Artificial Intelligence not a replacement for expertise: Airbus executive
content:
